Joe Biden met with Rishi Sunak at the White House on Tuesday.

The President of the United States and the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom discussed trade relations and climate policy. Biden, who has been in office since 2021, emphasized the importance of the transatlantic partnership.

The meeting took place in the Oval Office, where both leaders signed a joint declaration on technological cooperation. Sunak mentioned his recent conversations with European leaders including Olaf Scholz and Emmanuel Macron.

Apple Inc. announced a major investment in renewable energy. Tim Cook, CEO of Apple, stated that all Apple facilities worldwide will run on clean energy by 2030.

Microsoft is expanding its artificial intelligence research division. Satya Nadella, the company's CEO, unveiled new AI tools for businesses at a conference in Seattle.

Tesla opened a new manufacturing plant in Texas. Elon Musk, the founder and CEO, said the facility will produce electric vehicles and battery systems.

Amazon Web Services launched new cloud computing services for healthcare providers. Andy Jassy highlighted the importance of data security and privacy.

The Federal Reserve Bank raised interest rates by 0.25 percentage points. Jerome Powell, Chair of the Federal Reserve, explained the decision during a press conference in Washington, D.C.

Google announced plans to invest $10 billion in cybersecurity over the next five years. Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google and Alphabet, made the announcement at the company's headquarters in Mountain View, California.

At MIT, researchers presented a breakthrough in quantum computing. Professor John Doe led the team that achieved quantum supremacy using a new algorithm.
